I would recommend "A Fistful of Dollars". This classic western film, directed by Sergio Leone, features a star-studded cast including Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, and Gian Maria Volontè.

The plot revolves around two rival groups of outlaws who have been hired to settle a dispute between two neighboring families over a disputed land boundary. The two groups of outlaws, led respectively by the rugged but intelligent former US Army Ranger, John "Dust" Marley; and by the ruthless but cunning Mexican drug lord, Tuco "The Shawnee" Martino, are on their separate missions when they cross paths, becoming entangled in a complex web of intrigue, betrayal, and violence that threatens to tear apart not only these two rival groups of outlaws; but also the entire Western Hemisphere.
Overall, "A Fistful of Dollars" is an excellent film that offers a thrilling and action-packed storyline that will keep audiences on the edge of their seats from start to finish.
